column4: I am having a very tough time getting nvidia drivers installed
I have tried using the system>hardware drivers with no luck
modprobe nvidia shows module not found
cannot find nvidia.ko anywhere on my system
Geforce Go 8000M (laptop)
I have tried installing via nvidias driver but i cannot find appropriate kernel source files
I tried the ppa but it complains about not being able to find /include/version.h
are you running jaunty?
jaynty
where did you get the new kernel from?
> system about : > Thank you for your interest in Ubuntu 9.04>                 - the JauntyJackalope - released in April 2009.
have you setup any 3rd party repositories?
uname -r : 2.6.30-020630-generic
no 3rd party repo
because that kernel is not in the official repositories
ah 1 sec
http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/v2.6.30/
got it form there
you might have installed it manually or something like that
along with the source
then you need to look there for the source/headers
